ARABIC: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا دَاوُۥدَ مِنَّا فَضْلًا يَٰجِبَالُ أَوِّبِى مَعَهُۥ وَٱلطَّيْرَ وَأَلَنَّا لَهُ ٱلْحَدِيدَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We gave Dawud great favour from Us: 'O mountains and birds! echo with him in his praise!' And We
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We favoured David with excellence, (and commanded): "O Jibal and Tair, glorify the greatness of God with him." And We made iron pliable for him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We bestowed Our favour upon David. (We commanded): “O mountains, sing Allah's praises with him”; (and so did We command) the birds. We softened the iron for him, (saying):
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We granted David a favor by commanding the mountains and birds to sing Our praise along with him and softened iron for him
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And indeed We gave Dawud the utmost excellence from Us; “O the hills and birds, repent towards Allah along with him”; and We made iron soft for him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And indeed We bestowed grace on Dawud from Us (saying): "O you mountains! Glorify with him! And you birds (also)! And We made the iron soft for him."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And certainly We gave to Dawood excellence from Us: O mountains! sing praises with him, and the birds; and We made the iron pliant to him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And We gave David bounty from Us: 'O you mountains, echo God's praises with him, and you birds!' And We softened for him iron:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And assuredly We gave David grace from Us, (saying): O ye hills and birds, echo his psalms of praise! And We made the iron supple unto him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We bestowed upon David great favour. We said, "O mountains and birds! Join with him in celebrating Our praise." We softened iron for him, saying,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And assuredly We vouchsafed Unto Da'ud grace from us,' and said: mountains! repeat Our praise with him; and also ye birds! And We softened for him the iron.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Certainly We gave David our grace: ‘O mountains and birds, chime in with him!’ And We made iron soft for him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: We bestowed Grace aforetime on David from ourselves: "O ye Mountains! Sing ye back the Praises of Allah with him! and ye birds (also)! And We made the iron soft for him;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And indeed We bestowed grace on David from Us (saying): "O you mountains. Glorify (Allah) with him! And you birds (also)! And We made the iron soft for him."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We gave David bounty from Us. 'O mountains, and birds, echo (the praise of Allah) with him' And We softened iron for him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We bestowed upon David favor from Us: “O mountains, and birds: echo with him.” And We softened iron for him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We certainly gave David from Us bounty. [We said], "O mountains, repeat [Our] praises with him, and the birds [as well]." And We made pliable for him iron,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [34:10] And verily We bestowed on David a [great] favour from Us — prophethood and scripture — and We said: ‘O mountains, repeat with him [in praise], by making glorifications, and the birds [too]!’ (read wa’l-tayra in the accusative as a supplement to the [syntactical] locus of jibāl, ‘mountains’, in other words, and We also called on them to glorify [God] with him). And We made iron malleable for him, so that it was as dough in his hands.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And assuredly We gave David grace) kingship and prophethood (from Us, (saying): you hills and birds, echo his psalms of praise) hymn Allah's praise with David! (And We made the iron supple unto him) doing with it as he pleased, as he did with clay,
